replies.msg:
來自GMAT官方題目，搵唔到第三個破綻係咩，同埋想睇下可以點改善論述

The following appeared as part of an annual report sent to stockholders by Olympic Foods, a processor of frozen foods: “Over time, the costs of processing go down because as organizations learn how to do things better, they become more efficient. In color film processing, for example, the cost of a 3-by-5-inch print fell from 50 cents for five-day service in 1970 to 20 cents for one-day service in 1984. The same principle applies to the processing of food. And since Olympic Foods will soon celebrate its 25th birthday, we can expect that our long experience will enable us to minimize costs and thus maximize profits.”

Your response:

The argument presented by Olympic Foods is logical in a certain extent. However, the argument is not persuasive enough. The company states that the costs of processing decrease as it improves its efficiency and way of doing things. It cites colour film processing as an example to help strengthen the argument. The company also believes that its experience will help minimize costs and maximize profits. Without further information, it is hard to validate these assumptions, leading to some logical flaws.

The first flaw is the false comparison with the colour film processing. The argument compares the cost change of it with that of food processing. This is an inappropriate comparison as these two industries are completely different. The technology, products, knowledge etc. of each industry are not exactly the same. The success in one industry may not lead to another. The reduction in cost in color film processing may result from a new technology which isn’t able to decrease the cost of food. There are other reasons to consider when it comes to cost reduction in processing of food: supply of ingredients, demand in the market, competition, and marketing strategies etc. Without further clarification, the comparison may not be true.

The second flaw is the assumption that the long experience will help Olympic Foods minimize costs and thus maximize profits. There is no evidence proving that the experience will help the company achieve these results directly. The experience may only indicate how long has the business run. The company can minimize their costs by adopting newer technology, renewing facilities which can improve productivity, negotiating with suppliers for a better deal on ingredients, and reducing slow-moving items to save warehouse costs etc. Furthermore, more experience may not contribute to more profits. There are various reasons that lead to increasing profits, such as rising sales of products, less intense competition, price increase and surge in exports etc. Without further evidence, the argument relies on assumption only instead of facts.

While the argument makes some sense, it lacks a lot of information to validate it. Olympic Foods has to look into the real factors that influence costs and profits and conduct more research to support the assumptions it has made. Without them, the argument is only based on assumptions and it is difficult to judge whether the company can achieve the results it wants.
推

Actually the whole argument is very loose. As you have pointed out that the analogy of colour filming does not necessary follow that the same principle can be applied to the producer, it is also the fact that the 25-year experience does not imply that the producer can minimize costs.

Try to consider the sufficient condition and the necessary condition in logic. If a factor is not a necessary condition, it cannot “guarantee” another thing causally happen.

quote.msg:

Try to consider the sufficient condition and the necessary condition in logic. If a factor is not a necessary condition, it cannot “guarantee” another thing causally happen.

replies.msg:
睇左題目問你咩先。之後先睇文，再用二步曲去拆句子

1. Find the conclusion （通常睇key word: therefore, it follows that, researchers hypothesizes /concludes that )
2. Find the evidence/premise used to support the conclusion

揾好之後，題目通常都問你兩種野
1. Strengthen or weaken the conclusion
2. Draw a conclusion
第三種都有，不過唔多
3. Find the unstated assumption (so that the premise logically supports the conclusion)

第一種q. 如果題目問你Which one of the following strengthen the conclusion? 咁逐句choice 睇，你就問自己邊啲真係離譜到weaken 或者9 up咁就cross out. 揾四個錯去簡個岩。

第二、三種Q，就pretty self explanatory. 岩就岩，唔岩就唔岩。睇運氣

1. Find the conclusion （通常睇key word: therefore, it follows that, researchers hypothesizes /concludes that )
2. Find the evidence/premise used to support the conclusion

揾好之後，題目通常都問你兩種野
1. Strengthen or weaken the conclusion
2. Draw a conclusion
第三種都有，不過唔多
3. Find the unstated assumption (so that the premise logically supports the conclusion)

第一種q. 如果題目問你Which one of the following strengthen the conclusion? 咁逐句choice 睇，你就問自己邊啲真係離譜到weaken 或者9 up咁就cross out. 揾四個錯去簡個岩。

第二、三種Q，就pretty self explanatory. 岩就岩，唔岩就唔岩。睇運氣

replies.msg:
睇左題目問你咩先。之後先睇文。
會順暢啲
因為你睇完問題之後，佢問你which of the following would seriously weaken the argument
你一路睇文嘅時候，見到啲好general 既premise ，你可以即刻大約心理有數 ，可以順便諗埋個答案大約會講咩野。

佢有幾個statement 都冇support 你講左嗰兩個我唔講喇

1: cost go down because organization learn to do thing better and efficient. (Not necessarily true, as company develops in size may have unnecessary structure or procedures e.g 冗員， 香港政府）

2: 50 Cent of 5 day service to 20 cent of one day service. (Not example of increase in efficiency, the per day cost actually increased)

立下眼暫時搵到咁多
